content.description:
Start crouched with both hands matched on a good jug. Head straight up the faint corner on good holds.

This is a reasonably enjoyable warm-up.
content.location:
This is the leftmost route on the primary face of the boulder. It is located to the left of the obvious dihedral of '

The Lightness of Being

'.

content.description:
Start sitting with both hands on a choice of incuts at 4 feet. Gain the slopey sidepull undercling, and power out left to a good incut. The V6ish version continues angling left on grainy slopers. The V5ish version heads straight up to a good jug and finishes directly above. The V5 version is probably the better line, but the V6 version is how it was originally done.

The large jug to the right of the dihedral is 'off'.

Though slightly contrived, this line is still very worthwhile. Body position makes a big difference on this one.
content.protection: A couple of pads are nice as there is a rock in the landing zone.
content.location: This problem starts in the obvious dihedral on the main face of the boulder. When approaching from the First Boulder, it is on the side that faces away from you.

content.description:
Start standing with both hands on the large jug shelf. A large dyno or the use of an intermediate leads to a gritty sloper above. Finish out on good holds.

This is a fun, little climb.
content.protection: Two or three pads are nice.
content.location:
It is located in the center of the main face, to the right of '

The Lightness Of Being

'.

content.description:
Start standing with your left hand on an incut edge at around 5.5 feet and your right hand on the arete at the same level. (The start will feel quite spanned out to those shorter in stature.) Climb the double arete feature, exiting right after gaining the apex.

Per

Ross Perrot

: you can also exit left, which adds an extra move or two.

This has brilliant compression climbing and is definitely one of Telluride's best.
content.location: This climbs the obvious double arete compression feature that is staring you in the face as you approach from The First Boulder.

content.description:
This problem broke in the Fall of 2019 and became noticeably harder as a result.

It now starts standing with your left hand utilizing a slopey cobble crimp at 7 feet and the right hand on a small crimp at 6 feet (just left of the starting hold of 'Gravity's Rainbow). Pull up to a slopey edge (or don't) and then dyno for the juggy triangular shaped hold above. Finish out on grainy, but good holds.

More repeats are needed to confirm the grade post break.
content.protection: A couple of pads are nice.
content.location:
It is located immediately to the right of '

Light Years

'.

content.description: Start standing with some small edges at 5-6 feet, and climb the center of the tall slab. It has perfect rock and engaging movement.
content.location: This is located in the center of the slabby face that faces the trail when approaching from The First Boulder.
